column5: my best to your furry friend!  it sucks that these things happen and always when money is tight.  but you are doing the right thing.  hope he gets better soon  cheers!
Dang Rick.  We had a big one with one of our cats a couple years ago.  He just woke up from a nap on my chest!  Gotta love'm.  Sorry to hear about the divorce also.
Sorry to hear that Rick.  Best wishes.

Rick, You absolutely did the right thing for Jack! It's a shame that veterinary services are so darn expensive but I've done the same thing with my Golden. All I care about is that she's taken care of & I'll worry about the money later.... A person who cares about their dog is a person with a compassionate nature. When Jack is up & around again you'll know that you did your best for him & he'll thank you for it with some big, wet, sloppy kisses I'm sure.  I'll send lots of good wishes your way on Thursday! DebS
Man I feel for you.  I had to put my 15 year old Main Coon to sleep last week and that about tore me to pieces.  Best of luck to you  Bob
Best wishes and thoughts to you and Jack.  Hope it all goes for the best.
Hi Rick. Sorry about your pooch. I know how you feel about him.  I know I would have no choice either. Hope all goes well in the future for you and Jack. Take care and have a Merry Christmas.

My little buddy is only 7 months old right now and i already have grown to be very attached to him as well... can't imagine loosing him either.  I worked in animal hospital for five years and i know they treat animals better then we get treated when we go to the hospital....  So don't worry, he'll be fine.   best wishes,   lovetofish
Been there with Amy twice to the tune of $4000.....if Jack means that much to you then the right choice was made.  You can replace the money but not the dog.  Hope all works out well.
Hes lucky to have you bud....
Rick, I do wish you and your buddy the very best. The money can always be replace later. Your pet is part of your family.
Sorry to hear of your misfortune(s).....Jacks and your divorce....Take care Bud...

Rick...very sorry to hear this news...but you did the right thing.  Wish there was something I could do. Sorry it took so long to reply to this...just getting on the machine here at the in-laws place in Michigan and catching up on the board.  Good luck!
Sorry to hear the bad news rick...i hope all turns out well,and jack will be back to being himself in no time at all !!!! take care,and try to get some rest,as jack needs you to man !!!
WTG Rick you made the right choice your best friend has no price
I hope all turns out well Rick...  I miss our old pooch but there was really no other option...  Cats are ok but a dog is something special...  Take care...

Hey Rick,  I am very sorry to hear of your troubles.... I hope it all turns around for you and your pal after the surgery on Thursday. Until then; do the best you can to have a Merry Christmas!!!!  My thoughts are with you bro...
So sorry to hear this.  I used to think people were crazy putting that much money into a pet.....not anymore.  They become part of your family for sure.  Hope all goes well on Thursday Rick.

I know exactly how you feel Rick, and you're doing the right thing Bubba. You can't put a price on the love and devotion a pet gives you, they are a member of the family!  Here's to a speedy recovery for you and your best friend!

Rick sorry to learn about your budz mishap.  These animals gives us unconditional love and loyalty and in return they expect us to care for them. Money is not an issue when it comes to my pets health and well being.  Rest yourself, and try to have a Merry Christmas.  John
Hang in there Jack! Sounds like my dog Misha, she doesnt do pain very well either, but likes to think she is tough. I would have made the same decision you did Rick, dont fret, he'll be allright.
